children.subject:
Hey! I've taken CS70 and EE16B. I think CS70 & 16B in the same semester should be doable - I'm in 16B right now and especially with the new lab policies and exam formats its been very manageable in my opinion. I'm a CSM for CS70 and if the midterm is similar next semester, I will say that the exam might require tons of studying just because of the amount of content it has. Then I'm planning to take Data100 next semester too and while I don't think it's easy by any means I've generally heard that it isn't too horrible. Finally about EE16B and CS61C, I know some people taking those two as well as 170 together this semester, so I think CS61C and CS70 should probably be fine - 61C is very project based though I think. If you want to go into software I think 61C is probably better to take than 16B.

Hope that helps - I sort of have tangential info which is why I added it here instead of the student answer but hopefully some of the info I added adds value.

I'd recommend 61C + 70 since taking 61C will open up a lot of the upper div systems courses like 161, 162, 164, 168, 186, etc. (I took this schedule and think it's doable although both 61C and 70 are heavy, so I would recommend choosing a lighter 3rd class).
Eyyy am taking all three of them this semester. Just take all three and roll with it. It shouldn't kill you.

I'd go for 70 + 61c, it's nice to have a problem set class + a programming class, and if you're having trouble in 16A (especially if it's the labs) 16B isn't going to be any better. In particular, labs right now in 16B aren't the best.

history.content: if you still have to declare I would take 16b+70 instead 61c+70

children.subject: also it will be significantly harder to get into 16b later on so i would suggest taking it asap as others here have suggested

history.content:
Hi, I'm a junior transfer to Berkeley and an intended computer science major in L&S!

I'm considering taking either CS70 + CS61C or CS70 + EECS16B next semester (leaning toward the former, because I'm currently taking EECS16A and it's not necessarily a walk in the park for me...). I want to declare CS by the end of next semester, so CS70 is a must. I'll probably fill the rest of the units with DATA8 or DATA100 or an AC course or something. 

Has anyone taken this combo before, and if so, what are your thoughts? Will I hate myself next semester?? I'm doing relatively okay in 61A and 61B (will probably end the semester with an A- and/or B+), if this additional info helps!!
history.subject: 70 + 61C vs. 70 + 16B
